Tickets to the NRL Preliminary Final at ANZ Stadium. Tickets included ground entry and access to their private box and hospitality.

Travel, accommodation and hospitality for my wife and I were provided by the Taipei Economic and Cultural Office. From Thursday 2 December 2010 to Friday 10 December 2010, my wife and I were part of a bipartisan delegation to Taiwan.
Presented with a Robert's digital radio as a gift, the value of which I am unaware

On 14 July 2011, at the request of Energy Developments, I visited their facilities in Brisbane to discuss the impact of carbon pricing on waste coalmine gas and landfill gas production.  Energy Developments provided overnight accommodation as well as transportation to and from Brisbane Airport and to the relevant meeting. My wife, Bernadette, accompanied me on this visit.

On 23 September 2011, my wife and I participated in an overseas study tour to Europe. We travelled Qantas Airways and were upgraded from Premium Economy to Business Class from Sydney-Bangkok-London. On our return trip on 8 October 2011, London-Bangkok, we were again upgraded to Business Class from Premium Economy.

disclosures.entity: Australian Subscription Television and Radio Association (ASTRA)
disclosures.details: On Tuesday 6 December 2011 I took up an offer from the Australian Subscription Television and Radio Association (ASTRA) for a complimentary Foxtel service in my electorate office in Cabramatta.

On Thursday 5 January 2012, I attended the Sydney Cricket Ground as a guest of Westpac Banking Corporation to watch Day 3 of the Second Test, Australia vs India. My ticket included entry and hospitality.

disclosures.entity: Etihad Airways / HRG Australia Pty Ltd
disclosures.details: Together with my wife, we travelled on Etihad Airways and on the Sydney to Abu Dhabi section of the journey, we were both upgraded to First Class. Owing to a withdrawal of a Government Member, I was requested by the Chief Government Whip to join a multi party delegation at Budapest. All my travel arrangements were made through HRG Australia Pty Ltd.

On Thursday 7 June 2012 I hosted a Small Business Forum at the Liverpool Catholic Club with approximately 60 people attending. St George Bank and Goodwin Chivas were co-sponsors of this forum, contributing to the cost of the venue hire and light refreshments on the evening.

I advise that I visited Serbia as part of a four member delegation of the Australian Parliament, departing Australia on 13 January 2013 and returning on 23 January 2013. This visit was in response to an invitation by the Republic of Serbia. By agreement, the Serbian Government met the costs of accommodation and internal travel, whereas the Australian delegation met the costs of their own air travel. I further advise that the cost of my air travel was met from my unexpended study leave entitlements.
Recently, my wife and I took out a mortgage with the ANZ Bank on our home at 6 Hansens Road, Leumeah, NSW, to finance an extension to accommodate additional family members.

disclosures.entity: Australian Chinese Teo Chew Association Inc
disclosures.details: Please find enclosed copies of letters I have written to Mr Hung Ly and Mr Frank Chou, from the Australian Chinese Teo Chew Association Inc, regarding a gift of two bottles of wine. As can be seen from these letters, I did not retain the gift and have returned the bottles of wine to the Association.

On Friday 5 July 2013 I represented the Hon Tanya Plibersek MP, Minister for Health, at an opening of a Chinese Herbal Medicine business in Cabramatta where I was presented with an intricate Chinese hand painted scroll. I am unsure of its value, however, it would be appreciated if you would update my entry.
